discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCF
not copied from regulatory websites
1. Manual Entry:
•Manual entry 
•HTML
2. Import
•Transform Maps 
• Multiple source types such as JDBC, HTTP/ FTP, excel, CSV, XML
Customer-provided spreadsheets, data sourceslike SAP, etc. 
3. Content providers
• Usually requires subscription with a third-party 
• Integrations use either import transform maps or REST or SOAP APIs
•Some provide both the primary records and therelationship records
GRC: Content UCF; Edgile ARC; Risk Spotlight OpRisk Library; LexisNexis; Thomson Reuter Integration with RCM
4. Accelerators
•Some provide content and functionality for activities performed on the provided content
•Implementer can further configure post-installation
GRC: NIST CSF Use Case Accelerator; GRC: Technology Controls Monitoring Accelerator; GRC: Cybersecurity Controls Accelerator; GRC: SOX Content Pack; GRC: Continuous Authorization Monitoring

choices.D: They can be copied from the UCF
choices.E: They can be imported from Regulatory websites
choices.A: They can be imported from PDFs
choices.F: They can be imported from existing spreadsheets
choices.B: They can be imported via an API

questions.question_text: Which methods does ServiceNow support when migrating new policies? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer: C. Risk Framework, Policy, Authority, Document
Explanation: Document[sn_grc_document] extends to
 - Risk Framework[sn_risk_framework]
 - Policy[sn_compliance_policy]
 - Authority document[sn_compliance_authority_document]\
So C. is kinda stupid answer, but best fit, Document table only extends to 3 tables.... i am assuming authority, document referring to authority document[sn_compliance_authority_document] table
Source: PDI, sys_db_object Document[sn_grc_document] Schema Map
C - Risk Framework, Policy & Authority Document is correct. The comma between Authority and Document is probably a typo.

questions.question_text: Which collection of tables extend the Document table?
Which of the following tables are within the GRC: Policy and Compliance Management application scope? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Answer: 
 A. Authority Document
 C. Policy Exception
Explanation: C. Assessment is NOT a table Label, D. in the GRC: Audit Management Application
Source: PDI, sys_db_object list view

Selected Answer: AC
Authority Document
Policy exception
Verified in PDI

Selected Answer: CE
"Compliance administrators can download content from Network Frontiers Unified Compliance Framework (UCF) to use as GRC authority documents, citations, controls, and control objectives." https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/xanadu-governance-risk-compliance/page/product/grc-ucf-import/concept/c_UCF.html

Selected Answer: CE
ebook pg 66 - Authority docs and citations...

Selected Answer: AC
A. Policies - UCF integration allows the ingestion of policies from the Unified Compliance Framework, enabling organizations to manage and align their policies within the ServiceNow GRC platform.

C. Authority Documents - The UCF integration allows organizations to ingest authoritative documents, such as laws, regulations, industry standards, and frameworks, into ServiceNow. These documents provide the basis for compliance requirements and control objectives.

Options B (Risks), D (Issues), and E (Citations) are not typically ingested directly from the UCF integration:

questions.question_text: What content can be ingested into ServiceNow as a result of the UCF integration? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Only GRC scoped tables in ServiceNow

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer: D. Any table in ServiceNow
Explanation: Entity Types in ServiceNow GRC can use Entity Filters to generate entities based on any table in ServiceNow. This flexibility allows you to include data from various sources and create entities that represent different types of assets or objects within your organization.
Source: Verified in PDI explanation provided by Gemini

questions.question_text: Entity Types use Entity Filters to generate entitles based on which of the following?
